['Sloped - Having an incline or slant from one side to another.', 'Slanted - Resting obliquely; leaning at an angle.', 'Tilted - Set or placed on a diagonal position.', 'Angled - At an angle, not straight up and down or horizontal.', 'Curved - Having or characterized by smoothly rounded shapes rather than angular ones.', 'Arched - Forming an arch; curving inwards to form a semi-circular shape.', 'Bent - Deformed from its original position, typically due to pressure or force.', 'Leaning - Inclined or resting at an angle against something else for support.', 'Slanted Staircase - A staircase with a steep incline rather than being perfectly vertical.', 'Diagonal - At, directed in, formed by, or extending from a corner or angle.', 'Inclined Plane - An object that has one slope as opposed to flat surfaces (in physics).', 'Sloped Roof - A roof with an upward incline rather than being flat.', 'Angled Mirror - A mirror that reflects light at a specific angle, usually for reflection purposes.', 'Bent Wire - A wire twisted or deformed from its original straight shape.', 'Curved Lane - A lane or path with gentle curves instead of being perfectly straight.', 'Arched Window - A window designed with a curved upper edge, forming an arch above the opening.', 'Leaning Tower - A structure that has been intentionally tilted from its original vertical position due to erosion or other factors.', 'Tilted Screen - An electronic display screen that is set at an angle instead of being flat on a surface.', 'Sloped Ground - Land with varying levels, forming slopes and inclines rather than being level.', 'Curved Road - A road constructed with curves or bends instead of following a straight path.']

CLUE: Patches I assembled to work from several sources
OUTPUT: ['Mosaic - A pattern or image made from small colored pieces of hard material, typically stone.', 'Quilt - A textile craft consisting of stitching together multiple layers of fabric into a thicker padded material.', 'Patchwork - The process of sewing together various shapes and patterns of cloth to create a design or piece.', 'Tapestry - An intricately designed woven artwork, often depicting scenes or symbols.', 'Kintsugi - A Japanese craft where broken pottery is repaired with lacquer mixed with gold, silver, or platinum dust.', 'Zigzag - A pattern of sharp angles alternating in a single direction to create an interlocking design.', 'Fresco - An Italian mural painting technique executed upon freshly-laid lime plaster, often involving assembling small pieces.', 'Tilework - The art or craft of creating decorative designs using tiles made from ceramic, stone, glass, or other materials.', 'Patchwork quilt - A type of quilt created by sewing together different fabric patches to form a larger design.', 'Tapestry wallpaper - Wallpaper designed in the style of woven tapestries with various patterns and textures.', 'Quilting bee - An event where multiple individuals gather to work on quilt-making, often involving collaborating and sharing techniques.', 'Embroidery patchwork - A type of embroidered design made by sewing together small pieces of fabric or thread in a specific pattern.', 'Needlepoint sampler - An intricate needlepoint piece created by piecing together different stitches and colors to form a sample work of the various techniques used in the art.', 'Textile collage - The process of creating an assembled design from multiple pieces of fabric, often utilizing sewing or adhesive methods.', 'Tiled mosaic - An image created by assembling small, colored tiles to form a larger picture or pattern.', 'Miniature quilt assembly - The process of creating miniature-sized patchwork quilts using smaller fabric pieces and techniques.', 'Weaving technique - A method used in textile art where two sets of yarn (the warp and the weft) are interwoven to create a patterned design or material.', 'Cross-stitch gridwork - An embroidery technique that uses x-shaped stitches on a pre-printed fabric with an evenly spaced grid, often creating intricate designs by piecing together different colored threads.', 'Assembled textile art - A broader term for any form of textile creation where various elements are combined to create a finished work, such as mosaics or patchwork.', 'Beaded quilt assembly - The process of creating a quilt with beads sewn onto the fabric pieces to enhance design and texture.']
